name: Setup and Photos
section_name: Download the Memories app and add photos.
summary:
The FamilySearch Memories app enables you to add and tag photos, stories, documents, and audio for people in Family Tree.

Note : To add audio to a photo or document, see Choice C in Goal 4.

choices.name: Download the FamilySearch Memories app and view Memories.

hidden.content:
• Download the Memories app for Android or Apple devices.
  • Set up a FamilySearch account if necessary.
  • Sign in to FamilySearch.

content.text:
1. If you have already installed the FamilySearch Family Tree app,
    a) Open the Family Tree app;
    b) In the three-line menu (upper left) tap Memories;
    c) Tap Install; and
    d) Tap Open to begin. You will then be prompted to sign in to FamilySearch (see the step on account information below).
  2. If you have not installed the Family Tree app, you can visit the Google Play store (Android devices) or the Apple Store to download the app. Read the article to get started.

    ☆ FS—FamilySearch Tree App

  3. You will need a FamilySearch account to access Memories information. If you do not have a free FamilySearch Account, in the FmailySearch screen click Create Account (upper right) and follow the instructions. For more help with your FamilySearch account, refer to Goal 13: Account.
  4. Tap the FamilySearch Tree icon on your screen.
  5. Type your username and password, and tap Sign In. If you have forgotten your username or password, tap the link for username or password for help. For help with recovering an account or password, read this article.

    ☆ FS—Retrieve a Forgotten Name or Retrieve a Password - 2020


    6. Gallery View

  6. By default, all types of Memories (photos, stories, documents, and audio) that you have added are displayed. This is the Gallery view. To display only photos, stories, documents, or audio, tap the corresponding icon (top bar). To select all types, tap the same icon again.
  7. To sign out of FamilySearch, tap the menu (upper left) and select Sign Out.
Gallery View

choices.name: Add, crop, and title a photo in Memories.

hidden.content:
• Add photos from your device to your Gallery.
  • Crop photos and add titles for them.

• * Good: Add, crop, and title two photos.
  • * Proficient: Same as Good, for four photos. Also add at least one photo file to Memories from your device.

content.text:
1. In the lower right, tap the plus icon and then tap Add Photo. (The example at the right shows a Gallery that has existing pictures in a Gallery; your Gallery might be empty.) If a prompt appears asking to allow Memories to access your device's location, tap Allow.
  2. To take a photo for uploading,
    a) Tap Camera;
    b) If prompts appear that ask about allowing Memories to take pictures, record video, and access media, tap Allow;
    c) Take the photo;
    d) Tap the checkmark.
  3. To add a photo from a file on your device,
    a) Tap File;
    b) Navigate to the file on your device; and
    c) Tap the filename to add it to the Gallery.
  4. If you want to trim the photo,
    a) Tap Crop; Move the green selector points until the rectangle covers the area you want to keep in the photo; and
    c) Tap Crop.
  5. Tap Save.
  6. To add a title for the photo,
    a) Tap a picture in the Gallery;
    b) At the bottom of the screen, tap "Add a Title" and type the title, description, and event details;
    c) Select whether the memeory should be public or private; and
    d) Tap Save.
  7. To edit an existing photo title, tap the title name and follow the instructions above.

choices.name: Tag a photo to attach it to Memories, for a person in Family Tree.

hidden.content: • Identify a person in a photo and add a tag so the photo can appear for that person in FamilySearch.

• * Good: Tag three photos.
  • * Proficient: Tag at least four photos, and remove a tag from one of them.

content.text:
1. Tap the photo, if it is not already open.
  2. Tap the person icon (upper right). The number on the icon indicates how many people in the photo might be tagged.
  3. Tap a sizing square that appears, or tap a person in the photo. Then move the green dot to enlarge or shrink the square, so it fits over person in the photo you want to tag.
  4. If the correct name is already selected, you can use it for the title; otherwise, tap the "Add Name" link.
  5. Select the name or ID you want from the list, or begin typing to find it. If the name or ID does not appear, tap Add New next to the entry you typed to add it to the list.
  6. Tap Done. The photo is now available in the Memories area on FamilySearch for each person you tagged. Tagged individuals are indicated in the "Add Name" list, and the person-plus icon shows the number of people tagged in the photo.
  7. To delete a tag,
    a) Tap the tag square;
    b) Tap the "x" that appears; and
    c) Tap (upper right).

    8. Note : You can also tag a photo in the Gallery by tapping the folder icon above the photo.

Note : You can also tag a photo in the Gallery by tapping the folder icon above the photo.

Adding Topic Tags
  1. In an open photo, tap the tag icon (upper right).
  2. At the bottom, type the name of the topic tag and select it from the list that appears.
  3. Tap the plus icon to add the tag. You can add multiple tags to the photo.

choices.name: Perform various actions for a photo.

hidden.content:
• Share a Memories photo via text, Google Photos, Facebook, etc.
  • Download, convert to document, archive, or delete photos as needed.

• * Good: Share a photo using two methods, and download a photo to your devices.
  • * Proficient: Same as Good, for two photos each.

content.text:
1. To select actions for a photo that is currently open, tap the three-dot menu (upper right). The following options are available:
    • Rotate Right—The photo is rotated right by 90 degrees.
    • Record a Memory—Tap Start and record up to five minutes of audio for the photo; then tap Done. The recording is then available to be played, below the photo. To delete the recording, tap the Trash icon and then tap Delete.
    • Comments—Type a comment and tap Save to include it with the photo.
    • Details—Type the title, description, event date, and event place for the photo. You can also tap the down arrow to designate the photo as a public or private memory. Then tap Save.
    • Share— Choose a sharing option (if the option you want does not appear, tap the "See All" link) and follow the instructions in the sharing platform you chose.
    • Download—The photo will be downloaded to the Downloads location on your device.
    • Delete—Tap Delete again at the confirmation prompt.
  2. To archive photos in the Gallery view,
    a) Tap the three-dot menu (upper right) and tap Select Memories;
    b) Tap the circle for each photo you want to archive;
    c) Tap the three-dot menu (upper right) and tap Archive; At the prompt, tap Move to Archive.
  3. To delete photos in the Gallery view,
    a) Tap the three-dot menu (upper right) and tap Select Memories;
    b) Tap the circle for each photo you want to delete;
    c) Tap the three-dot menu (upper right) and tap Delete; At the prompt, tap Delete. Note: This deletes only the Memories you selected, not all Memories in the Gallery. You can also use the Delete option when you are viewing a photo, by using the three-dot menu.
  4. You can also add audio to a photo. For details, see Goal 4: Audio.

choices.name: Understand the privacy rules for FamilySearch that determine how information for living persons is handled.

hidden.content:
• You can see the record of a living person only if you created it.
  • Living people you create are hidden from everyone else, including the individuals themselves and your other family members.
  • Living people have a Private Person banner at the top of their Person page.
  • Memories attached to living people are potentially viewable by anyone.
• * Proficient: Review the bullet points in the summary and write down 3 key learnings from the privacy policy document in this Choice.

content.text:
Note : Generally, data for living people outside your immediate family cannot be viewed or searched for.

  1. Read this document to learn about the FamilySearch privacy policy and how it affects what you can see in your part of the tree.

    ☆ FS—Who can see my living relatives in Family Tree? - 2020

  2. For more information on privacy concerns and genealogy, watch this video.

    ☆ BYU—Privacy Concerns and Genealogy—68:24 - 2016

name: Stories
section_name: Create stories and add them to Memories.

choices.name: Search for stories that have been uploaded to Memories for your ancestors.

hidden.content:
• * Good: Find and read one or more stories for at least three ancestors.
  • * Proficient: Find and read one or more stories for at least 8 ancestors.

content.text:
1. Go to the All the Stories site.
  2. On the website, click Login, and then click Sign In at the FamilySearch prompt.
  3. Click Accept to share information with All the Stories.
  4. Click Let's go to download up to 9 generations of stories for your ancestors in FamilySearch.
  5. In the main part of the screen, hover over an ancestor circle to see how many stories are included on FamilySearch. Gray circle=no stories; light blue=1 or 2 stories; dark blue=3 or more stories.
  6. Click an ancestor circle to display vital information about the ancestor.
  7. In the left panel, click a story title to open it in the center panel. (The approximate time for telling the story aloud is indicated next to the story title and author in the left panel).
  8. In the right panel, a chart shows the relationship between you and the main person in the story. To see that person in FamilySearch, click the "View on FamilySearch" link.
  9. To mark a story as a favorite, click the star (top menu bar).
  10. To archive a story so it does not appear in the list, click Archive. It will appear at the bottom of the list of the left panel, under the Archive heading.
  11. To search for a story, type the name of the main person in the Search bar (upper left).

choices.name: Find stories you can upload to Memories.

hidden.content:
• * Good: Using the tips in this Choice, find two or more stories to upload to FamilySearch.
  • * Proficient: Using the tips in this Choice, find 5 or more stories to upload to FamilySearch

content.text:
1. Locate stories of interest in your personal collections, including letters, family books, and personal memories. Note : Be aware of copyright issues if you are using a published source for a story.

    ☆ FS—Gathering Family Stories—25:00

  2. Reach out to family for stories they might have about your ancestors, using ideas from these documents.

    ☆ LDS—Starting from Scratch
    ☆ FS—4 Family Stories You Must Save for Your Children

  3. Examine information in family records to uncover interesting stories to tell. These videos have tips for finding stories that are "hiding" in genealogy records.

    ☆ FS—Turning Genealogy into Family History, Part 1—26:15
    ☆ FS—Turning Genealogy into Family History, Part 2—26:19

choices.name: Create life stories for ancestors.

hidden.content:
• Fill out family histories with historic information by turning to records like newspapers, maps, and general accounts of events.
  • In addition to including history, bring in the cultural and behavioral aspects of stories to add new perspectives.

• * Good: Create a life story for an ancestor in your word processor, using the tips in this Choice. You may be able to upload this story in Choice D.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two ancestors.

hidden.type: d display and edit stories from memories.
hidden.content:
Stories can be a powerful way to connect you and others to your ancestors. Note: The Fan Chart view in FamilySearch can display a count of the stories in Memories for each ancestor.


Summary
  • Display stories and edit them.
  • Add photos to existing stories.


  1. To view stories in the Gallery, tap the Stories icon (second icon in the top bar).
  2. Tap a story to display it.
  3. To add a comment,
    a) Tap the three-dot menu and select Comments;
    b) At the bottom, type your comment; and
    c) Tap Save.
  4. To add details for the story,
    a) Tap the three-dot menu and select Details;
    b) Type the title and content for the story;
    c) To mark thge story as public or private, tap the down arrow and make your selection; and
    d) Tap Save.
  5. To share the story,
    a) Tap the three-dot menu and select Share;
    b) Choose a sharing option (if the option you want does not appear, tap the "See All" link) and
    c) Follow the instructions in the sharing platform you chose..
  6. To edit the story,
    a) Tap the three-dot menu and select Edit;
    b) Tap the place in the story where you want to start editing;
    c) Make your edits to the story.
  7. To add a photo to the story, tap the plus icon. You can then select Camera to take a photo with your device and add it, or File to add a photo from an existing file, or FamilySearch Gallery to add a photo from the Gallery. Then select the photo, to have it appear above your story in the edit screen. You can add up to 9 more photos for a story by clicking the plus icon again and following the above process.
  8. To add a title for the story,
    a) Below the story, tap "Add a Title";
    b) At the bottom of the screen, tap "Add a Title" and type the title; and
    c) Tap Save.
  9. To delete the story,
    a) Tap the three-dot menu (upper right);
    b) Tap Delete; and c) Tap Delete again.
Exercises
  • * Proficient: View stories in the Gallery and add a title and photo to at least two stories.

name: Documents
section_name: View, add, and manage documents in Memories.
summary: This Goal helps you get documents added for ancestors in Family Tree.

choices.name: Add new documents to Memories.

hidden.content: • Add documents to Memories, from your camera or from a file.

• * Good: Add one document from your camera and one from a file, and title them.
  • * Proficient: Same as Good, with two documents.

content.text:
1. In the Memories Gallery, tap the Document icon (top menu bar).
  2. In the Documents screen, tap the plus icon (lower right).
  3. Tap Add document.
  4. To take a photo of a document for Memories,
    a) Tap Camera;
    b) If prompts appear that ask about allowing Memories to take pictures, record video, and access media, tap Allow;
    c) Take the photo;
    d) Tap the checkmark.
  5. If you want to trim the photo,
    a) Tap Crop; Move the green selector points until the rectangle covers the area you want to keep in the photo; and
    c) Tap Crop.
  6. To add a title for the document,
    a) Below the picture, tap "Add a Title";
    b) At the bottom of the screen, tap "Add a Title" and type the title.
  7. Tap Save.
  8. To add a document from a file on your device,
    a) Tap File;
    b) Navigate to the file on your device; and
    c) Tap the filename to add it to the Gallery.
  9. To add a title to a document in the Gallery, tap "Add a Title" beneath the document and follow the instructions in the previous step.
  10. To edit an existing document title, tap the title name and follow the instructions above.

choices.name: View documents in the Memories Gallery.

hidden.content:
• View documents in the Gallery.
  • Tag and share documents in the Gallery.

• * Good: View and add or change the title for a document; then share it in two different ways.
  • * Proficient: Same as Good, for two documents.

content.text:
1. To view a document in the Gallery, tap the Documents icon (third icon in the top bar).
  2. Tap a document to display it; pinch or spread to zoom the view.
  3. To add a title for the document,
    a) Below the document, tap "Add a Title";
    b) At the bottom of the screen, tap "Add a Title" and type the title; and
    c) Tap Save.

choices.name: Tag a document to attach it to Memories, for a person in Family Tree.

hidden.content: • Tag documents for Memories.
• * Proficient: Tag two or more documents for Memories.

content.text:
1. Tap the document, if it is not already open.
  2. Tap the person icon (upper right).
  3. If a name list appears at the top, select the name or ID of the person represented in the document, or begin typing to find it. If the name or ID does not appear, tap Add New next to the entry you typed to add it to the list.
  4. To add a tag manually, tap the area where a person is pictured in the document. Then size the rectangle that appears, tap "Add Name", and select a name from the list.
  5. Tap Done. The document is now available in the Memories area on FamilySearch for each person you tagged. Tagged individuals are indicated in the "In This Document" list, and the person-plus icon shows the number of people tagged in the document. To remove a tag, tap the checkmark next to the person's name and tap Done.
  6. Note : You can also tag a photo in the Gallery by tapping the folder icon above the photo.

    c) Follow the instructions in the sharing platform you chose.

name: Audio
section_name: Listen to and add audio in Memories.
summary: This Goal helps you do interviews and add audio files for ancestors in Family Tree.

choices.name: Add new audio files to Memories.

hidden.content: • Record and add audio files.

• * Good: Record and add two audio files, with another person or youself doing the speaking.
  • * Proficient: Record and add three audio files, with at least one of them using another person to do the speaking.

content.text:
The Audio Files feature in Memories enables you to do recorded interviews from your device, quickly and easily, with a number of pre-selected topics. You can invite someone to interview, or you can address the topics yourself.

  1. In the Audio screen, tap the plus icon (lower right).
  2. Tap Record Audio. If a prompt appears for allowing Memories to record audio, tap Allow.
  3. In the Choose a Topic list, tap a question that the speaker will answer in the recording. If you don't see the question you want, tap Begin Recording to use your own topic.
  4. In the Recording screen,
    a) Tap the microphone icon (Start);
    b) Ask the question on the screen (or supply your own if you want) to the person you are interviewing; and
    c) Have the person you are interviewing answer the question as the recording proceeds. You can add your comments as you go.






  5. To finish the recording, tap Done.
  6. If you want to change the title for the recording, edit it on the screen.
  7. Tap Save. The audio file now appears in your Memories.

choices.name: Listen to audio files in the Memories Gallery.

hidden.content:
• Listen to audio files in Memories.
  • Add or change titles for audio files.
• * Proficient: Listen to two or more audio files, and add or change the titles for each.

content.text:
1. To listen to an audio file in the Gallery, tap the Audio icon (second icon in the top bar).
  2. Select an audio file in the Gallery and then tap the Play button. You can tap it again to pause the audio, or
  3. To add or edit a title for the audio file,
    a) In the three-dot menu, tap Add a Title (or Edit Title;
    b) Type or change the title for the audio; and
    c) Tap Save (or Done).
  4. To delete the audio file,
    a) Tap the three-dot menu (upper right);
    b) Tap Delete; and tap Delete again.

choices.name: Tag an audio file to attach it to Memories, for a person in Family Tree.

hidden.content: • Tag an audio file so it will be included in a person's Memories in Family Tree.

• * Good: Tag one or more persons in an audio file.
  • * Proficient: Same as Good, for at least two audio files.

content.text:
1. Tap the audio file, if it is not already open.
  2. Tap the person-plus icon (upper right).
  3. Select the name or ID you want from the list, or begin typing to find it. If the name or ID does not appear, tap Add New next to the entry you typed to add it to the list.
  4. Tap Done. The audio file is now available in the Memories area on FamilySearch for each person you tagged.

name: Albums
section_name: Create and manage albums for your Memories.
summary: Digital albums can be an easy and convenient way to keep track of your items in FamilySearch Memories.

choices.name: Create new albums.

hidden.content: • Create albums to organize your Memories.

• * Good: Create two new albums.
  • * Proficient: Create at least four new albums.

content.text:
Albums help you organize your Memories according to titles you choose.

  1. Review the items in your Memories Gallery and decide on titles for the albums you want.
  2. In the three-line menu (upper left), tap Albums.
  3. Tap the folder icon (lower right).
  4. Type the album name.
  5. Tap Save. The album is now available in your Gallery.

choices.name: Update, view, and manage albums.

hidden.content:
• Add memories to an album.
  • Edit album titles or delete albums as needed.

• * Good: Add one or more memories for at least two albums.
  • * Proficient: Add two or more memories for at least four albums.

content.text:
Note : When you add a Memories item to an album, the item exists in both the album and the Gallery. When you delete an album, the Memories items in it still exist in the Gallery.

  1. To add one or more Memories to an album,
    a) In the Gallery view, tap the three-dot menu and choose Select Memories;
    b) Tap the circle for each item you want to add to an album;
    c) Tap the plus icon (top row); and
    d) Tap the album name you want. The Memories are now available for viewing both in the Gallery and in the album. You can also create a new album in the list screen by tapping Create Album and following the prompts.
  2. To view the contents of an album, in the Gallery view, tap the three-line menu (upper left) and choose Albums. Then you can select an existing album to view.
  3. To add Memories to the album from the album screen, tap the plus-icon (lower right) and add each Memory as a photo, story, document, or audio file, as explained in the Goals in this project. You can also perform other actions for any item in the album, such as adding a title, sharing the item, deleting it, etc., by tapping the folder icon above the item and following the steps given elsewhere in this Project.
  4. To edit the title of an album,
    a) In an open album tap the three-dot menu (upper right) and select Edit Album;
    b) Change the title; and
    c) Tap Done.
  5. To delete an album,
    a) Tap the three-dot menu (upper right) and select Delete Album; and
    b) Change the title; and
    c) Tap Done.

name: Settings
section_name: Change the settings for your Memories.
summary: This Goal helps you determine the settings you use for the FamilySearch Memories app.

choices.name: Change settings for Memories.

content.text:
1. In the three-line menu (upper left), tap Settings.
  2. The following Preferences are available:
    • Enable Relationship Viewing—Let other users see how they are related to you in Family Tree.
    • Photo Gallery—Save a copy of any new photo to the library on your device (on or off).
    • Theme—Select Light, Dark, or System Default.
    • Download Memories—Download all items from your Gallery to your local device, for offline access. Tap this setting, and then tap Download.
  3. The following Notification Categories are available:
    • Downloads—Save a copy of any new photo to the library on your device (on or off).
    • Memories—Get notifications about issues with syncing memories.
    • General—Behavior (sound or display for a notification)
      Advanced: Sound (type of notification sound); Vibrate (off or on); Show notification dot (on or off); Override "Do Not Disturb" (off or on).
